verses.roman:
gandha-puṣpa-dhūpa-dīpe mahā-pūjā kaila
bhaṭṭācārye mānya kari' pāka karāila

synonyms: gandha—scents; puṣpa—flowers; dhūpa—incense; dīpe—by lamps; mahā-pūjā kaila—he worshiped the Lord with great pomp; bhaṭṭācārye—to Balabhadra Bhaṭṭācārya; mānya kari'-offering respect; pāka karāila—engaging in cooking.
translation: Vallabhācārya worshiped the Lord with great pomp, offering scents, incense, flowers and lamps, and with great respect he induced Balabhadra Bhaṭṭa [the Lord's cook] to cook.
